Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Sounds like a problem with serialization of the profile. When you add a
pro=
cessor to a job or profile via the web ui, the in memory objects are
modifi=
ed and this triggers an update of the disk based XML representations.
For s=
ome reason the change isn't being written through. There may be a bug
in th=
e processor implementation (check the heritrix_out.log - or console if
runn=
ing via Eclipse - for errors that occur just after you add the processor
to=
 a job or profile). If you'd care to share the processor, I could also
test=
 it.
 
- Kris

-----Original Message-----
From: Xavid [mailto:xavid@...=
] 
Sent: 7. jan=FAar 2005 19:58
To: archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com
Subject=
: [archive-crawler] Re: Memory and Module Problems


Sorry to post again, b=
ut I just found something else about my processor 
problem.  While the vers=
ion of the profile I created that the web 
interface displays still contain=
s my processor, the order.xml file for 
my profile on disk ends with the li=
ne: '    <map 
name=3D"write-processors">', and doesn't have any informatio=
n about my 
processor in it.  Any idea why this would happen?

Thanks for y=
our help,
Xavid Pretzer
